hit.Description: The witness, senior vice-president and controller at R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Holding Inc., was deposed by the plaintiffs. He described the financial status of the holding company and its economic activities. He indicated that industry changes, corporate changes, market changes, structural changes, and some legal developments have all had an adverse effect on the profitability of the company. The witness also noted that advertising and promotion restrictions placed on them in 1998 by the Master Settlement Agreement had caused a drop in sales volume. He said that punitive damage awards would have a devastating effect on the company, although he declined to say whether bankruptcy was being considered.
hit.Title: Deposition of THOMAS RICHARD ADAMS, March 15, 2000, WHITELEY v. RAYBESTOS-MANHATTAN INC.
hit.Witness_Name: Adams, Thomas Richard (affiliation: R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Holdings Inc.; job_title: Senior Vice-President and Controller; side: Defendant; witness_type: Fact)
hit.Organization_Mentioned: Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co. L.P.; United States Food and Drug Administration; United States Securities and Exchange Commission
hit.Topic: economic analysis; financial investment; profit; promotions
